newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico hails U.S. drug endorsement, attacks process.
newsitem.headline: Mexico hails U.S. drug endorsement, attacks process.

text.p: The Mexican government will applaud a U.S. decision on Friday to endorse it as an ally in the drug war but disagrees with the "interventionist" annual drug certification procedure, a government source told Reuters.

The source said the government would shortly release an official statement hailing the favourable U.S. decision as a recognition of Mexico's commitment to fighting drugs and of the results it had achieved.

"But, independent of the actual decision, we insist that the process of certification is unilateral and interventionist and that it does not help promote cooperation between governments," the source said.

Mexico's government will also insist in its official reaction that it was attacking drug-smuggling and drug-production because of its commitment to Mexican society and not because of any foreign pressure, he added.

Senior government officials were all unavailable for any immediate comment on the U.S. decision to recertify Mexico as a drug ally, announced earlier in Washington by Secretary of State Madeleine Albright.
At the presidency, officials said they did not plan to speak on the matter, saying any official statement would come from the Foreign Ministry.
